thread.title: Chief Economic Advisor Arvind Subramanian at Express Adda today
thread.title_full: Chief Economic Advisor Arvind Subramanian at Express Adda today

title: Chief Economic Advisor Arvind Subramanian at Express Adda today
text:
Chief Economic Advisor Arvind Subramanian at Express Adda today Chief Economic Advisor Arvind Subramanian at Express Adda today Subramanian will be in conversation with National Affairs Editor P Vaidyanthan Iyer and Deputy Editor (Rural Affairs and Agriculture) Harish Damodaran. By: Express News Service | New Delhi   4:09 am Chief Economic Adviser Arvind Subramanian. 
WITH the election campaign in full swing in the UP heartland, the political jury on demonetisation may still be out but the economic fallout has begun to show. 
And no one can explain it better than the chief guest at Express Adda here on Wednesday, Chief Economic Advisor Arvind Subramanian. 
Watch What Else Is making News 
His Economic Survey incisively — and elegantly — captured the entire range of political economy issues that go to the heart of a changing India. Like the startling revelation, based on rail passenger traffic, that annual migration within India touched 9 million, much higher than previously estimated. 
Subramanian will be in conversation with National Affairs Editor P Vaidyanthan Iyer and Deputy Editor (Rural Affairs and Agriculture) Harish Damodaran. 
Subramanian’s insight will help illuminate discussion on the Budget, the roadmap ahead, the ambivalence on reforms to the twists and turns en route to the Goods and Services Tax. Last October, he chose Sabarmati, the birthplace of Mahatma Gandhi , to flag the idea of a “universal basic income” scheme. He dwelt on it at length in the Economic Survey, too, suggesting this could well replace the 1,000-odd benefit or subsidy schemes that are currently run by the government.
